Detailed Description

A geometry constructed as the union of other geometries.

A geometry union is a geometry constructed from geometries so that a point is inside the union if it is inside any of the constituent geometries. If two or more of the geometries in the union overlap, the regions and media of the geometry with the highest priority win. As an example consider two intersecting spheres forming an union. For the region occupied simultaneously by both spheres the material in the sphere with the higher priority will be used. A geometry union is defined as follows: 

library = egs_gunion
geometries = list of names of previously defined geometries
priorities = list of integers defining the geometry priorities (optional)

The priorities key is optional. If it is missing, the priority decreases when moving from the front to the back of the list (i.e. the priority of is higher than the priority of , if ). If the priorities of the geometries are explicitely defined via the priorities key and and have the same priority defined, is still considered to have a higher priority if . A geometry union is used in the car.geom example geometry file.

Member Function Documentation

void EGS_UnionGeometry::setMedia ( EGS_Input *  ,
int  ,
const int *   
) [protected, virtual]

Don't set media when defining the union.

This function is re-implemented to warn the user that media should be defined for each individual geometry participating in the union, not in the union itself.

Reimplemented from EGS_BaseGeometry.
